Title: Data Scientist / ML-Engineer
Description:
ALGOTEQUE is an IT consultancy firm that helps startups, mid-sized and large corporations to create and deliver innovative technologies.

Our team has a successful track record in designing, developing, implementing, and integrating software solutions (AI, ML, BI, Web, Automation) for Telecom, Energy, Bank, Insurance, Pharma, Automotive, Industry, e-commerce. We deliver our services both in fixed-price and time-and-materials models, helping our customers achieve their business and IT strategies.

Job Description

Algoteque is seeking a talented Data Scientist / ML-Engineer to join our dynamic team. This role involves working on innovative projects for our clients, focusing on deep learning, model optimization, and production deployment.

Responsibilities

Deep Learning: Utilize deep learning techniques for tasks such as image, text, and video classification using neural networks.

Model Development: Collaborate with the team to develop, train, and research new and existing machine learning models.

ML-Ops: Implement and maintain ML-Ops practices to ensure models are effectively brought into production.

Data Science Ecosystem: Utilize the Python data science ecosystem, including tools like pandas and numpy, to analyze and manipulate data.

Feedback Loops: Develop and implement feedback loops to generate new training data as part of the machine learning lifecycle.

Best Practices: Apply best practices in machine learning and data science to ensure robust and reliable models.

Profile / Requirements

Deep Learning: Experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch and Tensorflow.

Python: Proficiency in Python and familiarity with its data science ecosystem, including pandas and numpy.

Statistics: Solid foundations in statistics to support data analysis and model validation.

ML-Ops: Experience in ML-Ops, including bringing models into production and maintaining them.

Production Models: Proven experience in implementing and optimizing machine learning models for production environments.

Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently on complex tasks.

Preferred Qualities

Innovative Thinker: Ability to think creatively and propose innovative solutions to complex problems.

Team Collaboration: Strong collaboration skills to work effectively with other team members and stakeholders.

Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying updated with the latest developments in machine learning and data science.

What We Offer

Innovative Projects: Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects for leading clients.

Professional Growth: Continuous learning and development opportunities.

Flexible Work Environment: Remote work.

If you are a dedicated Data Scientist / ML-Engineer with a passion for deep learning and model optimization, we would love to hear from you.

AO2901

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Crédit Agricole Personal Finance & Mobility, filiale 100% du Groupe Crédit Agricole, est spécialiste du financement aux particuliers et fournisseur d’accès à toutes les solutions de mobilités en Europe




Au sein du Corporate Center (fonction de gouvernance de CAPFM), la Direction Crédit Groupe a pour objectif d’accompagner le développement de CAPFM en sécurisant sa politique crédit sur 3 pilliers : encadrer la politique et piloter l’acceptation Retail, structurer et organiser le pilotage de la Valeur résiduelle, encadrer et piloter l’activité Corporate de toutes nos entités en France et à l’international.

Sur ces 3 activités (Retail, Corporate, Valeur Résiduelle), l’équipe de modélisation a pour objectif de cadrer le développement des scores sur toute la chaine d’activité crédit (octroi, prévention, fraude, recouvrement, contentieux, estimation des valeurs résiduelles) et d’accompagner nos entités sur les sujets de modélisation. De plus, l’équipe a un rôle de veille technologique, en proposant des solutions innovantes et en participant activement à la transformation technologique de CAPFM (IA, Open Banking).




Au sein de la Direction Crédit Groupe du Corporate Center de CAPFM, vous rejoindrez l'équipe Modélisation.

Vous aurez pour missions principales de :

Ø Mettre en place des modèles de scoring sur toute la chaîne crédit (octroi, prévention, recouvrement, contentieux, score jeune, score fraude) pour le comptes des entités à l’international et rédiger une documentation détaillée des modèles développés.

Ø Contribuer à l’optimisation des systèmes d’octroi (scorecards et règles métiers)

Ø Réaliser une veille technologique (open Banking, intelligence artificielle, intelligence augmentée,) pour challenger les process existants




Compétences recherchées

Capacité à échanger avec les autres experts métiers et des interlocuteurs IT sur les sujets techniques (ex : score, structuration des bases de données, etc…)

Capacité à mener de front plusieurs sujets

Capacité de synthèse et formalisation

Autonomie

Rigueur

Force de proposition

Curiosité

Bon relationnel, bonne communication

Esprit d'équipe

Maitrise de l’anglais

- Outils bureautiques (ppt, word, excel)

- Maitrise des outils de modélisation : Python, R, Dataiku, SAS

- Maitrise des environnements techniques (ex : SQL, Oracle, ..)

ANGLAIS courant

Localisation : Massy avec télétravail 2 à3j /semaine

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Morgan McKinley is delighted to bring this exciting new opportunity to market. This is a permanent post in a growing Artificial Intelligence & Data Team, in a highly successful organisation.




This role will offer you the chance to work with a variety of clients and technologies in a challenging and exciting environment. This team designs and builds architectures, automates processes, creates interactive visualizations, identifies patterns, develops predictive models, and uses AI technologies to extract actionable insights from data.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement AI solutions and algorithms to solve complex business problems.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and deliver AI solutions.
Collaborate with data scientists and software developers to integrate AI models into applications and systems.
Design and build machine learning pipelines and infrastructure.
Optimize AI models for scalability and efficiency.
Ensure the ethical and responsible use of AI technologies.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning.
Provide technical expertise and guidance on AI-related projects.
Manage and coach junior team members, providing both technical and non-technical guidance.




Qualifications:

Minimum of a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
Experience deploying data-driven and AI applications into production, preferably in a fast-paced environment.
Proficiency in statistical and exploratory data analysis, data mining, and machine learning techniques.
Experience working with large data sets and distributed computing tools such as Hadoop or Spark.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
Experience with Large Language Models (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropics, LLama, Gemini) including fine-tuning and prompt engineering practices.
Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau or PowerBI is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
Your Mission

As a Data Scientist specializing in simulation model development, your mission is to conceptualize, design, and refine simulation models that drive our platform's analytical capabilities. By applying advanced analytical techniques and machine learning algorithms, you will create models that are both accurate and predictive, providing invaluable insights into the real estate industry.

Your Responsibilities


You will develop and refine simulation models for various scenarios in the real estate industry.
You will apply statistical methods and machine learning algorithms to enhance model accuracy.
You will validate models with domain experts to ensure realism and compliance.
You will conduct research to stay updated with the latest advancements in data science and simulation techniques.
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate simulation models into the platform.



Your Profile


You possess a strong background in statistics, mathematics, physics, or machine learning.
You possess proficiency in programming languages like Python.
You have the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
You have excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
You possess strong communication skills to effectively convey technical concepts to stakeholders.



Bonus points:


You have experience in the real estate industry or related fields.
You are familiar with advanced simulation software and tools.



Why Predium?


Your Benefits: Enjoy an attractive membership with Wellpass, a subsidy for your job ticket, and free snacks and beverages in the office.
Your Vacation: Take advantage of 30 paid vacation days per year.
Your Flexibility: Embrace the flexibility to work from home, our beautiful office in the heart of Werksviertel, or even on a workation. We highly value a hybrid way of working.
Your Equipment: Work with the latest technology and digital tools. Choose your preferred equipment and work environment.
Your Events: Experience unforgettable company and team events that not only strengthen bonds but also provide loads of fun and inspiration. From co-operative outdoor activities to legendary parties – there’s something for everyone!
Your Team: Join our diverse and highly motivated team, and actively shape our unique company culture. We believe that a diverse workplace makes us stronger.

Show more
HTML:
Your Mission

As a Data Scientist specializing in simulation model development, your mission is to conceptualize, design, and refine simulation models that drive our platform's analytical capabilities. By applying advanced analytical techniques and machine learning algorithms, you will create models that are both accurate and predictive, providing invaluable insights into the real estate industry.

Your Responsibilities

  • You will develop and refine simulation models for various scenarios in the real estate industry.
  • You will apply statistical methods and machine learning algorithms to enhance model accuracy.
  • You will validate models with domain experts to ensure realism and compliance.
  • You will conduct research to stay updated with the latest advancements in data science and simulation techniques.
  • You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate simulation models into the platform.


Your Profile

  • You possess a strong background in statistics, mathematics, physics, or machine learning.
  • You possess proficiency in programming languages like Python.
  • You have the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  • You have excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • You possess strong communication skills to effectively convey technical concepts to stakeholders.


Bonus points:

  • You have experience in the real estate industry or related fields.
  • You are familiar with advanced simulation software and tools.


Why Predium?

  • Your Benefits: Enjoy an attractive membership with Wellpass, a subsidy for your job ticket, and free snacks and beverages in the office.
  • Your Vacation: Take advantage of 30 paid vacation days per year.
  • Your Flexibility: Embrace the flexibility to work from home, our beautiful office in the heart of Werksviertel, or even on a workation. We highly value a hybrid way of working.
  • Your Equipment: Work with the latest technology and digital tools. Choose your preferred equipment and work environment.
  • Your Events: Experience unforgettable company and team events that not only strengthen bonds but also provide loads of fun and inspiration. From co-operative outdoor activities to legendary parties – there’s something for everyone!
  • Your Team: Join our diverse and highly motivated team, and actively shape our unique company culture. We believe that a diverse workplace makes us stronger.

Title: Data scientist, Den Haag
Description:
White Space Energy is a (so far quite successful) young startup founded by a team of seasoned Oil&Gas professionals. We use state of the art deep learning techniques to assist customers with complex decision making across a broad portfolio including, a.o., logistics, maintenance, portfolio analysis and well design. We address these decision-making challenges by simulating business environments as complex games and by developing game agents to master these. The policies of the game agents then provide insight in how to optimize the customer’s decision strategy.

We are looking for an enthusiastic data scientist who is interested in joining our team to help develop game environments and agents on consultancy projects. To succeed you will need to have a strong affinity with problem solving, be delivery focused, and will need knowledge of and experience in machine/deep learning, preferably reinforcement learning.

About You

We highly value strong machine / deep learning engineers willing to help out with whatever moves our projects forward. You should have strong interpersonal skills and be a team player, flexible in adapting to changing requirements and able to cope with and reduce ambiguity. An ability to quickly understand, augment, test, and debug unfamiliar systems is valuable. A demonstrated interest in reinforcement learning is required. You should be fluent in Python.

Minimum Qualifications


– BS degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, machine learning or equivalent (MSc/PhD preferable).
– Strong knowledge and experience of Python.
– Knowledge of machine / deep learning, in particular reinforcement learning.
– Strong knowledge of algorithm design.
– Working knowledge of TensorFlow.
– Experience with data analysis.
– Previous interest in playing with and/or creating simulation models is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Avery Dennison Corporation (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and digital identification solutions company that provides a wide range of branding and information solutions that optimize labor and supply chain efficiency, reduce waste, advance sustainability, circularity and transparency, and better connect brands and consumers. Our products and solutions include labeling and functional materials, radio frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags, software applications that connect the physical and digital, and a variety of products and solutions that enhance branded packaging and carry or display information that improves the customer experience. Serving an array of industries worldwide — including home and personal care, apparel, general retail, e-commerce, logistics, food and grocery, pharmaceuticals and automotive — we employ approximately 35,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Our reported sales in 2023 were $8.4 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.

Avery Dennison is an equal opportunity employer.
Please let us know if we can support you with reasonable accommodations throughout the application process by contacting our team via Requestaccomodation@eu.averydennison.com.



Job Description



ABOUT YOUR ROLE:

The Data Scientist will be joining the European Materials Group Finance team and will work on some of the most interesting and challenging business problems, with the goal to to drive better business insights, improve efficiency and unlock value for our customers. In this role you will interact with business leaders across functions and engage the business in data-driven debates.

​You will utilize your skills and experience to systematically answer questions using data to provide actionable recommendations. You will commonly utilize advanced statistical analysis and machine learning techniques. You will be responsible for modeling complex problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. A successful candidate will have demonstrated experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations, such that they can efficiently and effectively develop solutions to a broad array of use cases.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:

Interpreting and analyzing data using exploratory mathematic and statistical techniques based on the scientific method

Formulating and leading guided, multifaceted analytic studies against large volumes of data

Coordinating research and analytic activities utilizing various data points unstructured and structured and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data

Analyzing problems and determining root causes

Translating complex results into simple, clear conclusions and visualizations

Explaining sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner

Defining company data assets, data models, and jobs to populate data models

Working closely with all European business units and cross functional teams to develop future models with the ability to link results to business processes

Coordinating with Data Engineers to build data environments providing data identified by Knowledge Managers and Analysts

Experimenting against data points, providing information based on experiment results and providing previously undiscovered solutions to command data challenges



Qualifications



WHAT WE WILL BE LOOKING FOR IN YOU:

Bachelor’s, Master’s degree (preferred), or other advanced degree required in computer science, business analytics, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or other data centric discipline

4+ years of relevant industry work experience providing advanced analytics solutions, with a focus on Forecasting based models.

Proficiency with one or more programming languages: Java, NodeJS, Python, R

Knowledgeable in some Cloud and Big Data technologies, such as Microsoft Azure, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Google Cloud Platform, Apache Spark

Analytics skills: descriptive statistical modeling & algorithms, machine learning algorithms, modeling dataset building, optimization, data visualization, pattern/cluster/segmentation analysis, predictive analytics, Analytics tools and Technologies like Qlikview, Cognos, Visual Basic, Apache, Oracle, SQL, GraphQL, NoSQL

Exceptional record of academic achievement, professional accomplishment, project management, and leadership

Passion for building and comfort working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)

Advanced analytical knowledge of data, ability to conduct big data analysis, data conditioning experience, programming advanced computing skill

Additional experience in core analytic methods such as predictive modeling and customer and product segmentation/clustering

Business sense: Basic knowledge of finance, manufacturing and commercial business processes and ability to translate business needs into data and explain complex concepts in an understandable manner

Project lead experience of cross functional teams is strongly preferred



Additional Information



We offer:

Attractive salary package
Workplace & work hours flexibility
Structured learning and development / Mentoring program
International environment
Events such as International Women’s Day, Earth Day, etc.
A growing and welcoming team with good spirit!

Who we are! - Our Story:

Every voice. Every day! Eight Values. One Team!

Being open to every voice, every day, brings our value of diversity to life and makes Avery Dennison a vibrant and engaging place to be. We understand diversity and equal opportunities as enrichment for our future-oriented work. Across our diverse, global team, every voice makes us stronger. When we listen to and learn from each other, there is no limit to what we can achieve together. Each of us is unique, and we appreciate bringing together different personalities and talents.

Avery Dennison is an equal-opportunity employer. In the EMEA region, we have these Employee Resource Groups:

EmpoWer - focusing on the engagement, mentoring, and promotion of women
Mental Health - striving to provide a safe space for employees to discuss mental health issues in the workplace
Unite - supporting the LGBTQI+ and ally community in the EMEA region

To find out more about all our employee resources groups globally as well as our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion approach, please go to our Diversity and Inclusion pages in the About Us section of our website: https://www.averydennison.com/en/home/about-us/diversity-and-inclusion.html

At Avery Dennison, we do what we love, and we love what we do - Just click here, and get to know us better: Life @ Avery Dennison (linkedin.com/company/avery-dennison/life/emea)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
En Verne Technology Group contamos con un equipo de personas dinámicas y comprometidas con el desarrollo y transformación continua de nuestro entorno. Apostamos por ofrecer calidad y actualidad tecnológica a nuestros clientes para acompañarlos en su crecimiento 🚀




¿Te apasiona la tecnología y ayudar a solucionar problemas con ella? Si eres una persona que quiere seguir desarrollando su carrera profesional y quieres participar en un equipo lleno de retos tecnológicos y multidisciplinares… ¡te hemos encontrado! 🔍




Buscamos profesionales de ML con conocimientos sólidos en Databricks para ampliar nuestro equipo de Machine Learning en España ☁️💻







💼 Principales funciones




Realizar la extracción, transformación y carga de datos necesarios para su uso en modelos de machine learning.
Identificar y seleccionar las variables más relevantes para la construcción de modelos.
Diseñar, implementar y ajustar algoritmos para adaptarlos a problemas específicos.
Probar y validar la eficacia y precisión de los modelos de machine learning mediante técnicas de validación cruzada, ajuste de hiperparámetros y métricas de evaluación.
Realizar la puesta en producción de modelos de machine learning asegurando su escalabilidad y mantenimiento.
Supervisar el rendimiento de los modelos de machine learning en producción, realizar ajustes y mejoras cuando sea necesario.
Trabajar en equipo con otros/as profesionales, como científicos/as de datos, ingenieros/as de software y especialistas en dominios específicos, para desarrollar soluciones integrales.
Evaluar las últimas tendencias, técnicas y herramientas en el campo del machine learning y aplicar nuevos enfoques y tecnologías cuando sea apropiado.
Explicar y presentar los resultados y las implicaciones de los modelos de machine learning a los interesados y colaboradores no técnicos.







📑 Requisitos deseables




Experiencia en el desarrollo de soluciones de machine learning en la plataforma de Databricks. Desde la experimentación hasta la puesta en producción.
Fluidez en el desarrollo de consultas SQL.
Tener experiencia en el desarrollo de código pyspark.
Conocer y saber aplicar los principios de MLOps.
Estar familiarizado/a con Unity Catalog para la gobernanza, detección y control de versiones.
Experiencia en el registro de modelos y puesta en producción de modelos con MLFlow. Así como la monitorización de experimentos.
Desenvolverse en el uso de la librería Apache Spark MLlib.
Saber implementar el ajuste de hiperparámetros mediante Hyperopt.
Estar familiarizado/a con la nueva herramienta de Databricks Asset Bundles.







🎓 Estudios requeridos

Ciclo de grado superior y/o grado universitario.
Nivel de inglés B2.
Se valorará positivamente experiencia adicional en la plataforma de Azure Machine Learning.







🖊️ Experiencia requerida

Experiencia mínima de 2 años como ingeniero en proyectos de ML.







🌟 ¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Aprender y experimentar con las últimas tecnologías.
Tener una amplia flexibilidad horaria para poder conciliar tu mundo laboral y personal
Jornada intensiva de verano.
Disfrutar de interesantes beneficios sociales.
Oportunidades de crecimiento y aprendizaje, colaborando con equipos multidisciplinares aportando valor a los proyectos.







¿Te identificas con alguno de estos puntos? Si crees que este puesto está hecho para ti, envíanos tu solicitud y nuestro equipo se pondrá en contacto contigo para conocerte y comenzar tu viaje más Tech 🤓







👉 Conoce más acerca de nosotros en #WeAreTech

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are expanding our development teams and although we don't care much about titles, we call this role Data Scientist.

As an Data Scientist Engineer, you will be part our international AI/ML team developing tailored solutions to satisfy our client's needs. We are looking for a passionate AI Engineer with background in machine/deep learning. You will be training, and deploying models, putting research into production, among other tasks.

You will be part of a multidisciplinary team, taking care of the software engineering challenges associated with AI. You will take part in challenging projects using cutting edge technologies. You will work in an international environment with the possibility of working from home or from our offices.

Our vision is to build multidisciplinary teams which directly manage projects in an AGILE way to find and implement the best solutions 😊

You will be responsible for:


Participating in the design and development of AI solutions for challenging projects
Building production level ML/AI solutions, with solid software engineering and ML/AI principles
MLOps
Automated deployment and monitoring (models and infrastructure)
Data analysis (data cleaning, variable transformation, etc.)
Developing and training ML models
Putting AI models into production. This means parallelizing, optimizing, tuning, testing the models to deploy in a production environment



Requirements

What are we looking for?


More than 5 years of experience in AI / Machine Learning / Computer Science
Can build an "end-to-end software product" which has machine learning component
Knowledges in applied computer vision.
Strong skills in Python and reasonable SQL understanding
Experience in building ML/deep learning pipelines and models
Experience in implementing production ready ML models using current ML/Deep learning techniques
MLOps experience is very valuable for the team
Experience in projects with NLP is neccesary


Very nice to have:


Experience with Deep learning frameworks like Tensorflow, PyTorch etc
Experience with Big Data projects and tools
Experience writing RESTful web services
Experience with DevOps technology (Docker, Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment, etc.)
Experience with source code version control tools
Experience working with Azure or other cloud-based solution
Azure Machine Learning: Experience with Azure Machine Learning is a plus, although not essential
Deep learning and neural networks. Expertise in deep learning and high-level neural networks.
Experience with one or more of the following: Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, recommendation systems, unsupervised learning, ranking systems or similar.
TensorFlow Lite, TensorFlow serving y grpc
Unit testing knowledge
Solid object-oriented programming skills



Benefits

What do we offer?


Salary determined by the market and your experience 🤑
Flexible schedule 35 Hours / Week 😎
Fully remote work (optional) 🌍
Flexible compensation (restaurant, transport, and childcare) ✌
Medical and dental insurance (completely free of charge for the employee) 🚑
Individual budget for training and free Microsoft certifications 📚
English lessons (1 hour/week) 🗽
Birthday day off 🌴🥳
Monthly bonus for electricity and Internet expenses at home 💻
Discount on gym plan and sports activities 🔝
Plain Camp (annual team-building event) 🎪
➕ The pleasure of always working with the latest technological tools!


With all this information you already know a lot about us. Will you let us know you better?

The selection process? Simple, just 3 steps: a call and 2 interviews with the team 🤘

And you may wonder... Who is Plain Concepts?

Plain Concepts is made up of 400 people who are passionate about technology, driven by the change towards finding the best solutions for our customers and projects.

Throughout the years, the company has grown thanks to the great technical potential we have and relying on our craziest and most innovative ideas. We currently have over 14 offices in 6 different countries. Our main goal is to keep growing as a team, developing the best and most advanced projects in the market.

We truly believe in the importance of bringing together people from different backgrounds and countries to build the best team, with a diverse and inclusive culture.

What do we do at Plain Concepts?

We are characterized for having a DNA 100% technical. We develop customized projects from scratch, technical consultancy and training.


We don't do bodyshopping or outsourcing
Our teams are multidisciplinary, and the organizational structure is flat and horizontal
We are very committed to AGILE values
Sharing is caring: We help, support, and encourage each other to expand our knowledge internally and also towards the community (with conferences, events, talks...)
We always look for creativity and innovation, even when the idea might seem crazy to others
Transparency is key to any relationship


To know more about us, take a look in our website:

➡ https://www.plainconcepts.com/case-studies/

At Plain Concepts, we certainly seek to provide equal opportunities. We want diverse applicants regardless of race, colour, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Apply for this job

We are expanding our development teams and although we don't care much about titles, we call this role Data Scientist.

As an Data Scientist Engineer, you will be part our international AI/ML team developing tailored solutions to satisfy our client's needs. We are looking for a passionate AI Engineer with background in machine/deep learning. You will be training, and deploying models, putting research into production, among other tasks.

You will be part of a multidisciplinary team, taking care of the software engineering challenges associated with AI. You will take part in challenging projects using cutting edge technologies. You will work in an international environment with the possibility of working from home or from our offices.

Our vision is to build multidisciplinary teams which directly manage projects in an AGILE way to find and implement the best solutions 😊

You will be responsible for:

  • Participating in the design and development of AI solutions for challenging projects
  • Building production level ML/AI solutions, with solid software engineering and ML/AI principles
  • MLOps
  • Automated deployment and monitoring (models and infrastructure)
  • Data analysis (data cleaning, variable transformation, etc.)
  • Developing and training ML models
  • Putting AI models into production. This means parallelizing, optimizing, tuning, testing the models to deploy in a production environment


Requirements

What are we looking for?

  • More than 5 years of experience in AI / Machine Learning / Computer Science
  • Can build an "end-to-end software product" which has machine learning component
  • Knowledges in applied computer vision.
  • Strong skills in Python and reasonable SQL understanding
  • Experience in building ML/deep learning pipelines and models
  • Experience in implementing production ready ML models using current ML/Deep learning techniques
  • MLOps experience is very valuable for the team
  • Experience in projects with NLP is neccesary

Very nice to have:

  • Experience with Deep learning frameworks like Tensorflow, PyTorch etc
  • Experience with Big Data projects and tools
  • Experience writing RESTful web services
  • Experience with DevOps technology (Docker, Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment, etc.)
  • Experience with source code version control tools
  • Experience working with Azure or other cloud-based solution
  • Azure Machine Learning: Experience with Azure Machine Learning is a plus, although not essential
  • Deep learning and neural networks. Expertise in deep learning and high-level neural networks.
  • Experience with one or more of the following: Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, recommendation systems, unsupervised learning, ranking systems or similar.
  • TensorFlow Lite, TensorFlow serving y grpc
  • Unit testing knowledge
  • Solid object-oriented programming skills


Benefits

What do we offer?

  • Salary determined by the market and your experience 🤑
  • Flexible schedule 35 Hours / Week 😎
  • Fully remote work (optional) 🌍
  • Flexible compensation (restaurant, transport, and childcare) ✌
  • Medical and dental insurance (completely free of charge for the employee) 🚑
  • Individual budget for training and free Microsoft certifications 📚
  • English lessons (1 hour/week) 🗽
  • Birthday day off 🌴🥳
  • Monthly bonus for electricity and Internet expenses at home 💻
  • Discount on gym plan and sports activities 🔝
  • Plain Camp (annual team-building event) 🎪
  • ➕ The pleasure of always working with the latest technological tools!

With all this information you already know a lot about us. Will you let us know you better?

The selection process? Simple, just 3 steps: a call and 2 interviews with the team 🤘

And you may wonder... Who is Plain Concepts?

Plain Concepts is made up of 400 people who are passionate about technology, driven by the change towards finding the best solutions for our customers and projects.

Throughout the years, the company has grown thanks to the great technical potential we have and relying on our craziest and most innovative ideas. We currently have over 14 offices in 6 different countries. Our main goal is to keep growing as a team, developing the best and most advanced projects in the market.

We truly believe in the importance of bringing together people from different backgrounds and countries to build the best team, with a diverse and inclusive culture.

What do we do at Plain Concepts?

We are characterized for having a DNA 100% technical. We develop customized projects from scratch, technical consultancy and training.

  • We don't do bodyshopping or outsourcing
  • Our teams are multidisciplinary, and the organizational structure is flat and horizontal
  • We are very committed to AGILE values
  • Sharing is caring: We help, support, and encourage each other to expand our knowledge internally and also towards the community (with conferences, events, talks...)
  • We always look for creativity and innovation, even when the idea might seem crazy to others
  • Transparency is key to any relationship

To know more about us, take a look in our website:

➡ https://www.plainconcepts.com/case-studies/

At Plain Concepts, we certainly seek to provide equal opportunities. We want diverse applicants regardless of race, colour, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Apply for this job

Title: DATA SCIENTIST - PROVEEDORES MEDICOS
Description:
¿Te encuentras en búsqueda de nuevos retos profesionales?

Desde MAPFRE España buscamos un/a Data Scientist: cuya misión será facilitar la toma de decisiones estratégicas mediante el análisis avanzado de datos y la implementación de modelos predictivos y prescriptivos, con un enfoque en la eficiencia operativa y el cumplimiento de las políticas de Gobernanza de Datos.




🧐🧐Detalles del empleo - Este puesto está orientado a un perfil que combina análisis de datos y ciencia de datos, con un enfoque práctico en la gestión de servicios médicos para una aseguradora. Se busca un equilibrio entre análisis técnico y aplicación de soluciones de negocio.

• Sector: Seguros

• Ubicación: Ctra. De Pozuelo, Majadahonda. Madrid

• Tipo de contrato: Contrato laboral indefinido

• Tipo de empleo: Jornada completa

• Horario: que cuenta con flexibilidad de entrada desde las 8.30 a las 10h.




Además de...

1. Un programa de retribución flexible....

2. Seguro de Salud

3. Acceso a un atractivo plan de ahorro y plan de pensiones.

4. Descuentos en los productos y servicios que nuestra entidad comercializa.

5. Acceso a importes fijos anuales para tu formación.

6. Ayuda escolar para hijos.

Y muchas cosas que te iremos contando ¡!




👉¿Qué funciones realizarías?

Realizar diagnósticos y análisis avanzados para proponer controles/soluciones basadas en datos
Acometer los planes de acción establecidos para el desarrollo y evolución de los procesos y resolver consultas especializadas
Elaborar informes y análisis técnicos que se deriven de su actividad bajo supervisión estándar, con el fin de facilitar a su responsable el seguimiento de resultados, y la toma de decisiones.
Mantener actualizado el conocimiento técnico, específico y/o especializado de los procedimientos, normativa, criterios técnicos..., en su ámbito de actuación
Identificar y priorizar necesidades analíticas promoviendo la eficiencia y la innovación.
Realización de análisis descriptivos y unifactoriales de la información a fin de facilitar la toma de decisiones y la interpretación por parte de los Usuarios de negocio.
Supervisar la calidad y el rendimiento de los modelos y de los datos utilizados
Diseñar soluciones predictivas para los desafíos de negocio




👉¿Qué necesitaríamos (Formación, experiencia...)?

Formación en visualización de datos con dominio herramientas BI (Power BI, Tableau, QuickSight)
Formación en ciencia de datos, aprendizaje automático
Competencia en herramientas analíticas y lenguajes de programación asociados (SAS, R, Python)
Habilidad de uso de Herramienta ofimáticas

También valoraremos que cuentes con:

Conocimiento del sector asegurador (especialmente salud) y/o experiencia, conocimientos en gestión de proyectos.
















“Todo proceso de selección que se desarrolla en MAPFRE se realiza bajo el principio de IGUALDAD DE OPORTUNIDADES y NO DISCRIMINACIÓN, siendo las APTITUDES y la VALÍA PERSONAL Y PROFESIONAL de la persona candidata, los criterios en los que se basa su elección final para el puesto de trabajo.

Creamos entornos de trabajo en los que se valora la diversidad y en los que no se producen discriminaciones por razón de sexo, raza, ideología, religión, orientación sexual, edad, nacionalidad, discapacidad o cualquier otra condición personal, física o social.”

Al inscribirte en esta oferta quedas informado y consientes el tratamiento por parte de MAPFRE, de los datos personales que has facilitado voluntariamente a través de esta plataforma. Si facilitas datos de terceras personas físicas distintas de ti, garantizas haber recabado y contar con el consentimiento previo de los mismos para la comunicación de sus datos y haberles informado.

MAPFRE como responsable, tratará tus datos, con la única finalidad de tramitar su participación en procesos de selección, para lo cual se podrán elaborar perfiles y del tratamiento de sus datos se podrá derivar la existencia de decisiones automatizadas. Con la finalidad de gestionar tu participación en diversos procesos de selección en empresas del Grupo MAPFRE, filiales y participadas, y Fundación MAPFRE, tus datos podrán comunicarse a dichas entidades, y ser objeto de transferencia internacional.

Puedes consultar información adicional de protección de datos en MAPFRE en https://www.mapfre.com/corporativo-es/clausulas/RRHHseleccion.pdfdonde te indicamos donde ejercer los derechos de acceso, rectificación, supresión, limitación, oposición y portabilidad de tus datos personales.

Puedes consultar nuestra política de Diversidad e Igualdad de Oportunidades: politica-de-diversidad-e-igualdad-de-oportunidades.pdf (mapfre.com)

Para conocer más ofertas de empleo te invitamos a que accedas a TRABAJAR EN MAPFRE y te des de alta en nuestro portal de empleo.

Title: Data Scientist IA
Description:
¿Te apasionan los retos? Izertis es tu empresa.




Buscamos a una persona apasionada por la ciencia de datos y la inteligencia artificial para incorporarse a nuestro equipo de tecnologías emergentes en el desarrollo de proyectos de I+D y en cliente de inteligencia artificial de forma 100% remota.




¿Qué hacemos?




En el equipo de tecnologías emergentes desarrollamos productos y proyectos digitales innovadores de calidad con un fuerte componente de innovación en un entorno cambiante. Somos un equipo de personas que saben organizarse por sí mismas trabajando en remoto y en constante aprendizaje.

Estamos trabajando en Computer Vision, NLP/NLU/NLG y ciencia de datos, aunque también tendrás oportunidad de colaborar en proyectos de productos digitales, blockchain, criptografía y computación cuántica.

Nuestro objetivo es acompañar a nuestros clientes a explorar, evaluar e implementar la tecnología que se utilizará en la próxima década.

En Izertis, estamos comprometidos con la innovación y la excelencia en la creación de productos digitales de vanguardia. Nuestro equipo de Tecnologías Emergentes se enfoca en desarrollar soluciones innovadoras en un entorno en constante cambio. Somos un equipo de profesionales autodirigidos que trabajan de forma remota, siempre en búsqueda de aprendizaje y crecimiento.

Estamos dedicados a la aplicación de metodologías como Design Sprint, User Story Mapping y User Journey para capturar los requerimientos de nuestros clientes y transformarlos en soluciones digitales de alta calidad. Trabajamos mano a mano con desarrolladores para llevar a cabo la ejecución de estos proyectos tecnológicos.




¿Qué harás?




Desarrollar y optimizar modelos de inteligencia artificial basados en los requisitos del cliente.
Participar en el desarrollo de propuestas técnicas y económicas para proyectos de financiación pública, internos y de cliente.
Identificar y mitigar riesgos asociados con los datos y los modelos de IA.
Asegurar la entrega de software y documentación en cada una de las fases del proyecto.
Seguir la metodología de gestión de proyectos definida por la compañía.
Supervisar y orientar a otros miembros del equipo.
Participar en ceremonias y reuniones ágiles.
Investigar y mejorar la pila tecnológica y las bases de conocimiento de la empresa.




¿Qué valoramos?




Autogestión: Capacidad para establecer y cumplir objetivos de manera independiente, demostrando una fuerte iniciativa.
Proactividad y Comunicación: Habilidad para colaborar y comunicarse efectivamente en equipos multidisciplinarios, mejorando constantemente nuestros procesos de trabajo.
Precisión y Detalle: Pasión por el trabajo meticuloso y preciso en la manipulación y análisis de datos.
Experiencia Práctica: Amplia experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos de inteligencia artificial y aplicación de técnicas de ciencia de datos, así como en proyectos de inteligencia artificial.
Experiencia en la redacción de propuestas, ejecución y justificación de proyectos de I+D con fondos nacionales y europeos.
Fundamentos del Desarrollo de Software: Conocimiento sólido de los principios fundamentales del desarrollo de software.
Experiencia con Git: Dominio de herramientas de control de versiones en equipos de desarrollo.
Pensamiento Crítico y Resolución de Problemas: Capacidad para analizar situaciones complejas y encontrar soluciones efectivas.
Nivel de Inglés Avanzado: Habilidades de comunicación en inglés, tanto oral como escrita.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Buen ambiente de trabajo.
Proyecto estable con contrato indefinido.
Salario establecido mediante acuerdo entre conocimientos y expectativas.
Formato trabajo remoto con 2 meses de jornada de verano.
Formación continua que aplique al puesto de trabajo.
Formar parte de una gran compañía.




¿Quiénes Somos?




Izertis con más de 25 años de experiencia, incluida en el índice BME Growth y entre las 1.000 empresas que más rápido crecen entre los países europeos, te da la oportunidad de desarrollar tu carrera profesional junto a más de 1.800 emplead@s a través de sus oficinas distribuidas por Europa, América y África y con presencia en más de 50 países donde prestamos servicios y proyectos a través de un amplio portfolio de soluciones.

  • Formato trabajo remoto con 2 meses de jornada de verano.
  • Formación continua que aplique al puesto de trabajo.
  • Formar parte de una gran compañía.

Izertis con más de 25 años de experiencia, incluida en el índice BME Growth y entre las 1.000 empresas que más rápido crecen entre los países europeos, te da la oportunidad de desarrollar tu carrera profesional junto a más de 1.800 emplead@s a través de sus oficinas distribuidas por Europa, América y África y con presencia en más de 50 países donde prestamos servicios y proyectos a través de un amplio portfolio de soluciones.

Title: R&D Data Scientist - CDI
HTML:
About Descartes Underwriting

Descartes was born out of the conviction that the ever-increasing complexity of risks faced by corporations, governments and vulnerable communities calls for a renewed approach in insurance. Our team brings together industry veterans from the most renowned institutions (AXA, SCOR, Swiss Re, Marsh, Aon, ...) and scientists on top of their field to bring underwriting excellence. After 5 years of existence, Descartes has secured a leading position in parametric insurance for weather and climate-related risks utilizing machine learning, real-time monitoring from satellite imagery & IoT. After a successful Series B raise of $120M USD, we launched Descartes Insurance, a 'full stack' insurer licensed to underwrite risk by the French regulator ACPR. With a growing corporate client base (350+ and counting), our diverse team is headquartered in Paris and operates out of our 13 global offices in North America, Europe, Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan. Descartes is trusted by a panel of A-rated (re)insurers to carry out its activities.

About Your Role

Descartes Underwriting is seeking a R&D Data Scientist to join our R&D Team. At the core of our company’s strategy, your missions will focus on making direct contributions to the development of new climate models.

Your missions will include:

  • Improve and/or develop new models to enhance and strengthen our understanding of climate risks;
  • Conduct research on the modeling of climate risks and machine learning methods;
  • Identify new and innovative ideas and test state-of-the-art methods from scratch based on recent research articles;
  • Collaborate with the Underwriting and Business teams to ensure our products are efficiently integrated into the underwriting process and meet our clients’ needs;
  • Work autonomously and pragmatically to make appropriate technical decisions.

About You

EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS

  • Master’s Degree (ideally research-oriented) in applied mathematics, statistics, meteorological studies or physics;
  • From 0 to 2 years of experience (internship and/or apprenticeship included);
  • Multi-disciplinary curriculum with strong skills in statistics, applied mathematics, physics and machine learning methods;
  • Ideally a previous experience in climate modeling or data science;
  • Proficiency in Python.

Skills

  • Strong team spirit and ability to work under pressure;
  • Eagerness to solve complex problems and technical challenges;
  • Rigorous, creative and meticulous mind;
  • Fluency in English (written and verbal communication) is required;
  • Good command of one additional language (e.g. Chinese, French, Italian, German, Spanish…) is valued.

MINDSET

  • Interested in weather and natural perils modeling (cyclones, wildfires, hail, tsunamis, earthquakes etc);
  • Strong desire to learn and commitment to the organization’s mission;
  • Results oriented, high energy, with the ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment;
  • Motivated to help improving businesses’ and communities’ resilience to climate change.

WHY JOIN DESCARTES UNDERWRITING ?

  • Opportunity to work and learn with teams from the most prestigious schools and research labs in the world, allowing you to progress towards technical excellence;
  • Commitment from Descartes to its staff of continued learning and development (think annual seminars, training etc.) ;
  • Work in a collaborative & professional environment ;
  • Be part of an international team, passionate about diversity ;
  • Join a company with a true purpose – help us help our clients be more resilient towards climate risks;
  • A competitive salary, bonus and benefits;
  • You can benefit from a punctual home office days.

RECRUITMENT PROCESS

  • Step 1: HR Interview with our Talent Recruiter
  • Step 2: Technical online test
  • Step 3: Remote technical interview with a R&D Data Scientist
  • Step 4: In-person team interview to meet our R&D Data Scientist team, your future managers and discover our offices (held remotely if you are abroad)

At Descartes Underwriting, we cherish value of diversity whatever it may be. We are committed to fighting against all forms of discrimination and for equal opportunities. We foster an inclusive work environment that respects all differences.

With equal skills, all our positions are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world’s visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions – and our methods for creating them – help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.




About the Team:

Join Keysight's central AI team in Barcelona, a newly formed division dedicated to innovation and excellence in machine learning. As we build this new team from the ground up, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the future of our AI initiatives and make a significant impact from day one. Our team is a hub of innovation where top-tier researchers and engineers collaborate to create cutting-edge ML technologies that power our world-class products and services.




We are at the forefront of AI research, driving advancements in supervised and unsupervised learning, generative models, temporal learning, multimodal input streams, deep reinforcement learning, inverse reinforcement learning, and large language models. At Keysight, we are passionate about pushing the boundaries of what is possible. Our mission is to develop transformative ML solutions that address real-world, large-scale problems, ensuring our products lead the industry in performance and reliability.




As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work on pioneering projects, develop state-of-the-art algorithms, and contribute to the evolution of technologies that enable the next generation of design and test products, including those for the 6G era. We foster a dynamic and collaborative environment where innovation thrives, and every team member's contribution is valued. Our cross-functional teams work closely to integrate AI/ML solutions seamlessly into our products, ensuring that we meet and exceed the needs of our customers.




If you are driven by curiosity, inspired by challenges, and ready to make a significant impact, Keysight's central AI team is the place for you.




About the Role:

We are seeking several highly qualified individuals to join our newly build AI-team as Machine Learning Engineers of different Specializations. We are dedicated to research and development in the field of machine learning within the design and test industry. As part of the team, you will have the opportunity to be the first to work on some of the most challenging technical problems and develop innovative ML solutions that will influence the future of Keysight’s products and business operations.




You'll be developing innovative ML solutions for our next-generation design and test products, enabling 6G. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams across Keysight to ensure that the AI/ML solutions are seamlessly integrated within our products.




We're looking for someone who is self-motivated, thrives in dynamic environments, quickly builds relationships, and adapts to change and ambiguity. Strong programming skills and experience crafting, prototyping, and delivering sophisticated algorithmic solutions are essential.







We have various openings and are hiring several ML Engineers specialized in at least one of the following areas:




Training, Developing, and Fine-Tuning Large Language Models (LLMs) on Custom Data for Code and Content Generation Tasks
Signal Processing and Deep Learning in Communications/Networking
Machine Learning in Communications and Networks
Machine Learning Optimization and Design Synthesis in the Electronic Design Space
Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) and Transformers for Temporal Modeling










Responsibilities:

Work with large datasets; extract and manipulate data using tools such as Spark SQL, command line, and scripting languages.
Design, develop, validate, and maintain predictive models and pipelines using the latest machine learning technologies.
Implement and deploy machine learning models to improve business metrics.
Develop tools to enhance the development, deployment, and lifecycle of machine learning models.
Collaborate with stakeholders, including customers and internal teams, to ensure alignment and success.
Understand and prioritize customer needs, conveying this urgency to product development teams.
Inspire and challenge development teams to achieve high performance sustainably.







Required Qualifications:

Master’s degree with 1-3 years of experience or PhD degree
In-depth knowledge of deep learning (DL) and statistical machine learning (ML)
Strong understanding of predictive modeling and machine learning algorithms (supervised and unsupervised learning, classification, regression, clustering, CNN/RNN/LSTM/Transformer, etc.)
Proficiency in programming with Python and C++
Hands-on experience with TensorFlow or PyTorch







Desired Qualifications:

Experience with the complete MLOps workflow, including data platforms, training infrastructure, and edge deployment
Passion for developing intuitive, maintainable, and well-documented software tools/apps
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, meet tight deadlines, and independently explore new ideas to improve Keysight products and operations
Creative and collaborative mindset
Strong verbal and written communication skills







What we offer:

A place within an exciting company! At Keysight we develop with our visionary, market-leading, and highly innovative customers breakthroughs that connect and secure the world. We offer you a highly competitive package. See our culture and our Benefits.







At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight – People and Culture - Youtube.

HTML:
Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world’s visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions – and our methods for creating them – help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.
